sub_title: Innovation Scientist | Specialist of Scientific Markets
summary:
Innovation scientist with a long experience in research, business development, and bringing new products to the market. My expertise bridges the gap between science and industry. I develop radiation detection solutions to advance scientific discovery, analytic instrumentation, and non-destructive testing. Trained as a high-energy physicist (PhD 2011), I am currently enrolled in a global executive MBA program.

At Photonis, I am responsible for developing new particle detectors, often in collaboration with customers, leveraging the capabilities of our many manufacturing facilities worldwide. I turn these detectors into marketable products, working with our R&D teams to gain a technological advantage, based on my insight into the needs of research markets. I have contributed to multiple patents and publications in my field. In addition, I have leveraged my skills in new business development, data analysis, and communication to find new markets and applications for Photonis' detectors and other instrumentation, and to initiate product development towards those applications. I enjoy working in a dynamic and collaborative environment, where I can learn from and share my expertise with others.

profile_positions.description: Developing new particle detectors, often in collaboration with customers, based on the capabilities of Photonis’ four manufacturing facilities worldwide. Turning these detectors into marketable products. Working with Photonis R&D teams to gain a technological advantage, based on my insight into the needs of research markets.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Scientist

profile_positions.description: Finding new markets and applications for Photonis’ detectors and other instrumentation, initiating product development towards those applications, and endeavoring to penetrate this market.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Developing neutron scattering instrumentation for the European Spallation Source (ESS),
specifically spin manipulation components for polarized neutron beams used for small angle
scattering and imaging.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Developing and producing detectors for beam profile measurement, and the infrastructure
to assemble and test them.
profile_positions.title: Senior Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Research and development on the technology of the Gas Electron Multiplier (GEM), in order
to make large area gems and spherically shaped GEM detectors.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Student

profile_positions.description: Developing the sLHC upgrade of the ATLAS pixel detector and its front-end electronics.
profile_positions.title: PHD Graduate Student

profile_positions.description:
Developing instruments for the gas system of the compass RICH1 detector. This included a VUV
optical instrument for measurement of gas transparency and a sonar system for determining
the composition of a binary gas mixture.
profile_positions.title: Technical Student
